TextView.android:text: Links are very important — they are what make the Web A WEB. To add a link, we need to use a simple element — — the a being short for anchor . To make text within your paragraph into a link, follow these steps: 1. Choose some text. We chose the text Mozilla Manifesto . 2. Wrap the text in an element, like so: Mozilla Manifesto •• Give the element an href attribute, like so: Mozilla Manifesto •• Fill in the value of this attribute with the web address that you want the link to link to: Mozilla Manifesto 4. You might get unexpected results if you omit the https:// or http:// part, called the protocol, at the beginning of the web address. After making a link, click it to make sure it is sending you where you wanted it to. href might appear like a rather obscure choice for an attribute name at first. If you are having trouble remembering it, remember that it stands for hypertext reference. Add a link to your page now, if you haven't already done so.
